name: Bugs Life
description: A bug lives in a world which is a cuboid and has to walk from one corner of the cuboid to the opposite corner (see the picture below). ### Task Define a function which takes 3 arguments: the length `a` , width `b`, and height `c` of the bug's "world", and finds the shortest distance needed to **walk** from start to finish. The dimensions will be positive numbers. **Note**: The bug cannot fly and has to maintain contact with a surface at all times but can walk up walls. ### Example ``` a=1, b=2, c=3: distance=4.242640687119285 ``` ___ ### Hints **Hint 1**: Consider how many different routes can be made to get from start to finish. If stuck for where to start, click [here](https://www.flickr.com/photos/141856599@N06/42176717300/in/dateposted-public/) for general guidance. **Hint 2**: Consider using paper and opening up the net of a cuboid (and think if there are multiple ways this can be viewed) and play around with it to find the shortest length.
